About

This website showcases an (incomplete) implementation of a code completion system based on the Qwen2.5-Coder family of models. It contains a VSCode extension that sends code snippets to a server, which then returns a single line completion suggestion. The server is implemented in Python using a custom API server for logins, and a custom message queue for handling requests from multiple clients into a single thread for running the model on GPU. The client is implemented in TypeScript using the VSCode extension development API, and additionally contains some custom GUIs for displaying differences between two code snippets for comparison.

Parser Project Showcase

About

Python/Typescript AST parser

A TypeScript implementation of a TypeScript/Python AST parser, which serves to minify and compress TypeScript and Python source code to only include function signatures and class attributes for reducing the LLM model's input size due to quadratic complexity with respect to input context size.
